casebody.data:
INTERSAL, INC.
v.
HAMILTON, et al. 115PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. February 8, 2019 David H. Harris, Jr., Attorney at Law, Durham, for Intersal, Inc. Brian Rabinovitz, Special Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Charles G. Whitehead, Special Deputy Attorney General, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, for North Carolina Department of Natural and Cultural Resources, et al. Jeffrey A. Doyle, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Joshua D. Neighbors, Attorney at Law, for Friends of Queen Anne's Revenge (Non-Profit Corporation)

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Reply Brief filed on the 7th of February 2019 by Plaintiff:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 8th of February 2019."

Plaintiff shall have up to and including the 25th day of February 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
